item.title: HTTP Serving Compressed File
item.description: Abstract Most browser support gzip, deflate, br Program language builtin support gzip, deflate, br has community support Nginx - ngx_http_gzip_static_module Conclusions: Check config: if gzip_static enable or not ? Check request header: client support gzip or not ? when using common algorithm, like “gzip”, skiping this seems no problem Mapping url to file path with given rule (filename extension is “.gz”) Setting response’s headers: Content-Length/Last-Modified/Etag?/Content-Type? Ensuring response’s header Content-Encoding: gzip // nginx-1.
